content: in Hegel & Heidegger, an “it is necessary (il faut)” re: hermeneutic circle of art > must start w/ work of art, but how can you recognize it as art if you don’t already know what art is?: not a vicious circle, but an engagement of thought, circular feast, experience of limit, closure, resistance, humility > pas de cercle: le désir par cette répétition fidèle du cercle, d’accéder à l’encore infranchi, le désir d’un nouveau pas > lien sans liens, franchir le cercle sans s’affranchir de sa loi, pas sans pas

content: le se-protéger-de-oeuvre (ergon), énergie captée, bordée, condition for mastery of PP, self-protection of energeia > energeia not as pure, total presence (prime mover), but as (par)ergon against what’s lacking in it, lack not as a substantial emptiness, but as impossibility of arresting differance in its contour, in a pose, of localizing lack, like metaphysics does, in its proper place: castration as truth (circular) > whether parergon borders (works against) free energy or essential lack, the 2 determinations sont le même (métaphysique)

content: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau

linkedContent: [why man and horse are different though both examples of adherent beauty]

content: [the paradox of the Critique] paradigm of beauty rests on idea of reason: there’s idea/ideal, adequation & mimēsis in beauty? ideal beauty would then be adherent, not free beauty, only an ideal of imagination/presentation (Darstellung); man, endowed w/ reason, the only being capable of a sans (of ideal of beauty), of giving himself his own ends; he is not errant, cannot conceive himself w/out goal, but he can put errancy, sans, into perspective; in this way man can never be aestheticized, carries himself away from his own aesthetic, the stakes of the “Copernican Revolution” [?] (sans of pure cut is effaced in him) > Kant never asks whether the beauty of man stems from possibility of morcellement sans négativité

content: beauty & sublime: please by themselves, independent of judgment of senses & determinate judgments, pretension to universal validity on side of pleasure (not knowledge), both reflexive judgments > beautiful (finite) requires parergon, presence of limit gives form to beautiful, this bordered edging not only externally limited but called in by hollowing of lacunary quality w/in the work (ergon) > colossal/sublime excludes parergon, not ergon, usually nature, “w/out limit”

content: abyss, the privileged presentation of sublime (the ocean)

content: sublime does violence to our imagination, all the more sublime for that, shock, double bind (attraction, repulsion), violent incommensurability
linkedContent: sublime does violence to our imagination, all the more sublime for that, shock, double bind (attraction, repulsion), violent incommensurability

content: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality [Blanchot’s awaiting oblivion vs. Levinas’ face-to-face?]
linkedContent: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality [Blanchot’s awaiting oblivion vs. Levinas’ face-to-face?]

content: “pleasing-oneself-in” of sublime suspends play, elevates to seriousness, nur negativ, relates to moral law, both presuppose violence done to senses, w/ sublime violence done by imagination, not reason > imagination mutilates itself, conceals itself, binds, robs itself: sacrificial violence gains by losing > organizes expropriation w/in calculation > imagination organizes theft of its own freedom, feels sacrifice/theft at same time as the Ursache to which it submits [see GOD]

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: beauty: w/out interest; sublime: counter-interest
linkedContent: beauty: w/out interest; sublime: counter-interest

content: feeling of colossal, experience of inadequation of presentation to itself, the colossal is the figure of the incommensurable, it is inadequately incommensurable, sa propre béance > elle se détermine en son contour, se taille et s’entaille comme incommensurable au sans-taille, voilà une première approche du colossal en érection
linkedContent: feeling of colossal, experience of inadequation of presentation to itself, the colossal is the figure of the incommensurable, it is inadequately incommensurable, sa propre béance > elle se détermine en son contour, se taille et s’entaille comme incommensurable au sans-taille, voilà une première approche du colossal en érection

content: unlike beauty, sublime must be found w/in ourselves
linkedContent: unlike beauty, sublime must be found w/in ourselves

content: though Kant’s examples of the sublime are nature, it is only found w/in ourselves, so all comments on sublime are an appendix to aesthetics of natural finality
linkedContent: though Kant’s examples of the sublime are nature, it is only found w/in ourselves, so all comments on sublime are an appendix to aesthetics of natural finality

content: Hegel reproaches Kant for starting from cise and not from w/out cise: i.e. the sublime, for Hegel, goes beyond symbol, expresses itself only by marking annihilation of expression, in sublime, content (infinity itself, the one, substance) sublates form > Kant is wrong to think subjectivity, finitude, could signify it, but Kant would respond in principle: one can only think w/out cise, the colossal, by way of figure [signified infinity vs. signifying finitude]
linkedContent: Hegel reproaches Kant for starting from cise and not from w/out cise: i.e. the sublime, for Hegel, goes beyond symbol, expresses itself only by marking annihilation of expression, in sublime, content (infinity itself, the one, substance) sublates form > Kant is wrong to think subjectivity, finitude, could signify it, but Kant would respond in principle: one can only think w/out cise, the colossal, by way of figure [signified infinity vs. signifying finitude]

content: for Kant & Hegel, pas crossing line finite/infinite interrupts symbolic beauty > Judaism as historical figure of sublime irruption: ban on representation (Kant), Hebraic poetry (Hegel)
linkedContent: for Kant & Hegel, pas crossing line finite/infinite interrupts symbolic beauty > Judaism as historical figure of sublime irruption: ban on representation (Kant), Hebraic poetry (Hegel)

content: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)
linkedContent: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)

content: deconstruction can pose questions from inside Kant’s discourse, questions can be parergonal (posed there w/out being posed there)
linkedContent: deconstruction can pose questions from inside Kant’s discourse, questions can be parergonal (posed there w/out being posed there)

content: why is “quantum” for sublime, which is unmeasurable, always considered large? this logic must be similar to St. Anselm’s
linkedContent: why is “quantum” for sublime, which is unmeasurable, always considered large? this logic must be similar to St. Anselm’s

content: w/ sublime, everything that is compared to it is small > here, Kant throws a bridge, the bridge like the symbol throws itself [by way of reason?], btwn unpresentable and presentation > the whole world can be made small in relation to sublime magnitude
linkedContent: w/ sublime, everything that is compared to it is small > here, Kant throws a bridge, the bridge like the symbol throws itself [by way of reason?], btwn unpresentable and presentation > the whole world can be made small in relation to sublime magnitude

content: for Kant, imagination: intermediate btwn sensibility & understanding
linkedContent: for Kant, imagination: intermediate btwn sensibility & understanding

content: colossal: that which (or presentation of that which) can be taken in hand [Fassen] or eye w/out possibility of being taken, thus crushes you not w/out pleasure, elevates you
linkedContent: colossal: that which (or presentation of that which) can be taken in hand [Fassen] or eye w/out possibility of being taken, thus crushes you not w/out pleasure, elevates you

content: human body as topos of experience of sublime because it is a median btwn sensibility & mathematical indefinite
linkedContent: human body as topos of experience of sublime because it is a median btwn sensibility & mathematical indefinite

content: small/big (problem of sublime) measured against, w/in, living body of man > starting from it, the erection of the largest is preferred
linkedContent: small/big (problem of sublime) measured against, w/in, living body of man > starting from it, the erection of the largest is preferred

content: imagination (btwn sensibility & understanding) has 2 operations, is the cise because it has 2 cises: 1) has the cise of what it delimits 2) and cise of what it de-limits, i.e. that which is liberated in it of its limits [apprehension lets go in comprehension what it gains in apprehension]
linkedContent: imagination (btwn sensibility & understanding) has 2 operations, is the cise because it has 2 cises: 1) has the cise of what it delimits 2) and cise of what it de-limits, i.e. that which is liberated in it of its limits [apprehension lets go in comprehension what it gains in apprehension]

content: distance required by the sublime opens up perception to space of narrative? divergence btwn apprehension/comprehension? doesn’t it call itself, w/ narrative voice: the colossal?
linkedContent: distance required by the sublime opens up perception to space of narrative? divergence btwn apprehension/comprehension? doesn’t it call itself, w/ narrative voice: the colossal?

content: distance from colossal, to be colossal (not too far, not too close), aesthetic maximum w/out losing itself in mathematical infiinite > relation of body to stone
linkedContent: distance from colossal, to be colossal (not too far, not too close), aesthetic maximum w/out losing itself in mathematical infiinite > relation of body to stone

content: “we shall come back to it after moving slowly around its [the colossal’s] site”
linkedContent: “we shall come back to it after moving slowly around its [the colossal’s] site”

content: colossal: irreducible passage btwn presentable & unpresentable > taille, bordure, bords de coupure, ce qui passe et se passe, sans passer, de l’une à l’autre
linkedContent: colossal: irreducible passage btwn presentable & unpresentable > taille, bordure, bords de coupure, ce qui passe et se passe, sans passer, de l’une à l’autre

content: monstrous (prodigious, ungeheuer) defeats end that forms concept, colossal presents limit of conceptualization: borders on monstrous, neither culture nor nature
linkedContent: monstrous (prodigious, ungeheuer) defeats end that forms concept, colossal presents limit of conceptualization: borders on monstrous, neither culture nor nature

content: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime
linkedContent: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime

content: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height
linkedContent: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height

content: Fort: Da colossal: ce qui vient-là-devant-s’ériger, erected in its own erasure, obscenity of its abyss
linkedContent: Fort: Da colossal: ce qui vient-là-devant-s’ériger, erected in its own erasure, obscenity of its abyss

content: même s’il y en a, la taille de cette entame n’existe pas > trace of each trait what's presented sans taille
linkedContent: même s’il y en a, la taille de cette entame n’existe pas > trace of each trait what's presented sans taille

content: have to have been double, superelevates itself on both sides of its own cise, il est des deux côtés sa propre taille, il est de sa propre taille des deux côtés : double column/colossus, hence its resonance
linkedContent: have to have been double, superelevates itself on both sides of its own cise, il est des deux côtés sa propre taille, il est de sa propre taille des deux côtés : double column/colossus, hence its resonance

content: glas et galactique du colossos, the bridge [tree?] over the abyss which threatens to swallow everything, interval btwn dynamic/mathematical sublime, on edge of which analytic of sublime is broached (s’entame): whirlpool heaves/tears tree into la dissemence laiteuse (the question is the cipher writing on the surface of nature)
